intro: Hemitelia boninsimensis, commonly known as the Bonin hemitelia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or rocky habitats, showing adaptations to saline and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest in botanical research.
